title: PS/Adult
subject: Career Development Framework For College and Career Readiness (2022-)

document.title: Maryland Career Development Framework For College and Career Readiness Grades Pre-K – Postsecondary (PS)/Adult

95FE73D4A63F4037BA18526CF54EAB5B.description:
Evaluate how technology has
changed and determine
implications for one’s lifelong
learning.

02DAD1560CE54DAAB90FDC8A72D85680.description:
Evaluate how society’s
needs/functions and economic
conditions affect one’s career
management (e.g. demographics,
global competition, economic
recession, and war).

3C67AE9AB916491C9EE6095F9602C175.description:
Demonstrate ongoing use of
informal and formal learning
experiences into one’s lifelong
learning activities.

D948AD444C924F4BAF036E9C66B1FDFF.description:
Evaluate selection of specific
postsecondary education and
training programs as they relate
to changing societal and
economic conditions and update
personal and career goals.

DBF1E83F8B4244FD8C191013BB92E6C0.description:
Explain that our diverse and
changing economy requires the
updating of existing skills and
the acquisition of new skills
throughout life.

485205FCF4D345428E2D59B2CEC87FF9.description: Evaluate the impact of lifelong learning on one’s ability to function effectively in a diverse and changing economy.

A0A28AAB219940B8BFAAE878F34E8147.description:
Analyze opportunities that exist
for lateral or vertical movement
from a current position and/or
for enriching current
responsibilities and apply a
decision-making process/ model when a career transition
is required.

ADB30C6F17B64889AF82D7CA5BFEA002.description:
Identify other positions that use
cross cluster or transferable
skills and apply a decisionmaking process/model when a
career transition is required.

2B9A1FABBCF44BDDBFAA55D0ED7D6513.description:
Investigate additional education
and training as needed for
career retention and
advancement.

1B49972ADF274B6F97F87EDD41ACEF78.description:
Evaluate the impact of one’s
education, work, family, and
economic/labor market
conditions when making
decisions.

D5AA8D1FC92C49E083319F9CA43A2767.description:
Demonstrate career
development skills and
behaviors and integrate them
into one’s approach to career
development (e.g. resiliency,
self-efficacy, ability to scan the
environment for trends and
changes, having a futures
perspective, and flexibility).

4682CB9006A648AE9AC31B8BAE0039DE.description:
Evaluate and integrate, as
appropriate, changes and trends
into one’s career plans.

F997A3ADADBC4B66B344A6D962EA9409.description: Apply career management and decision-making skills to update ones’ career plan as needed.

679EDA44FFA349F89BE5F215A86B9F5B.description:
Career Satisfaction and Transition – Individuals shall demonstrate how the ongoing attainment of knowledge and skills enhances one’s ability to function and transition
effectively in a diverse and changing economy.

4AEFE28299334C1C8DB88A432239D4DA.description:
Select an offering in one’s
career pathway that has high
probability for career
satisfaction and progression,
and negotiate effectively for
salary and other forms of
compensation.

BB8A7852AA1C4CD6A59F416F7D65F928.description:
Demonstrate a variety of skills
and behaviors to maintain
employment such as thinking
skills, the ability to work on
cross-functional teams, strong
interpersonal skills, technology
skills, communication skills,
honesty and other positive
personal qualities.

7C4616C30EB548188297BF69AF78779B.description:
Determine career preference
regarding geographic mobility
and one’s employability.

0D37A4660296453A9724779449A07431.description:
Assess the impact of one’s
decisions regarding
employment in a nontraditional career

C9EFC5B98AAF4C3FA351DDABF5C10E60.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in
transferable skills that lead to
advancement within a career
cluster of occupations (e.g.
business management finance
cluster: financial management
and accounting, legal services,
regulatory compliance, risk
management, government
relations, marketing.)

3A24B81914764232A7952C2C85C8182F.description:
Demonstrate skills to seek
employment including writing
a resume and cover letter,
completing a job application,
interviewing for a job, finding
and pursuing employment leads
and marketing oneself in the
workplace.

CD2ADCDE2E0C4D76878774802E20BD55.description:
Demonstrate proficiency in
academic and career-related
content standards, training
requirements, and core
employability skills (i.e. Skills
for Success).

C78587A189374D44BCB695031506C82A.description: Understand how academic, technical, cross cluster and employability skills are needed to obtain or create, maintain, and advance in one’s career

87FA1253E4304CA8AC2273B648077399.description: Job-Seeking and Advancement – Students shall demonstrate skills to secure, maintain and advance in employment.

B3D011D0BABD485B99491336E7351FFC.description:
Complete the steps and
timelines for selecting
education, training, and
employment options.

FB92C815B5C0484A9552E1811AA45047.description:
Analyze existing plan to
identify academic and career
preparation needs.

404921255FCA4E0089A1E4AC9A97BC68.description: Use the selected decision-making process/model to update and modify the six-year academic and career plan.

0F64E5351C6042518C8CF35ACB7C0502.description:
Update career folder/portfolio
to demonstrate academic and
technical knowledge and skills
of a career cluster for
employment and postsecondary
preparation.

9A6AB96172334819BFEF6DBEC973D20C.description:
Apply academic and career
related skill and the Skills for
Success through project-based
learning and, if applicable,
CTE programs of study and
other career connecting
activities.

2B25A87C4E9242B19F278AA7009E358C.description:
Apply academic and careerrelated cluster content
knowledge and skills
(foundation, pathway, cross
cluster) through technology,
research, problem-solving,
work-based learning, and
project-based learning.

9330946806EC4964BEB56B523EDBE0A2.description:
Successfully complete
academic or training
requirements.

4F0173ED9C6647AF91AE39BE15C9FCA4.description: Acquire cluster and academic content knowledge and skills to succeed in high school and beyond.

67CDAC695DD5438E87049155176DDEA5.description:
Career Preparation: Students shall prepare for postsecondary and career success through a sequenced academic and technical program of study and related workplace
experiences.

C48110A4BFFD40C59541E505BD949968.description:
Describe the impact of one’s
culture, beliefs, attitudes, work
values, and family life on one’s
career decisions.

29BD65CF72D044F28C2DB4D7D9800F0C.description:
Demonstrate the use of a
decision-making model on a
consistent basis as part of one’s
ongoing career management.

D737D08F4C574E399FC0FFB75BE5D88E.description: Use a process/model for knowing and thinking about how one makes decisions.

18BFD84834594D5EA2FA77E6C8AE6529.description:
Select options for further
education and/or training (twoand four-year
college/universities, credit by
exam, apprenticeships,
technical schools.)

BC2C8015363A4276A0614875DD9F996C.description:
Apply academic/career-related
content standards including
CTE programs of study to
work-based learning
experiences and one’s career
management plan.

DDF816F8952F480B80120FA563531ED2.description:
Assess program sequence for
selected academic/ careerrelated program of study and
modify plan.

61C2C7F4EAE846EE91C75EA5112F3572.description:
Demonstrate the knowledge and
skills necessary to transfer
effectively from a two-and fouryear college degree to a
graduate school program.

5894F2B132E745B4BE1E7F7D05C0353F.description:
Modify one’s plan as needed to
reflect ongoing career decisions.

5C3798021E20458BB11167AF45AFC450.description:
Prepare an academic and career plan based on high school graduation requirements, a sequence of Career Technology Education (CTE) program of study courses,
related academics and postsecondary options.

21B900F763264E2F91B16F08DD756314.description:
Career Exploration – Students shall assess career cluster choices and related career pathways including Career Technology Education (CTE) programs of study in order to
develop an academic and career plan.

97E0B405149D4302A92D08493A7310F4.description:
Determine how one’s life roles
impact one’s lifestyle.

EF4C9052CD3945FD9970CAF85C3E57C1.description:
Examine and evaluate how one
balances life roles and
responsibilities and determines
desired changes.

D61AD1D40AFE4D9A824D19B2EB774AFD.description: Understand that balancing personal, leisure, community, learner and work roles is an important part of one’s career development.

D3AF822258D24D478237C69C05A504C1.description:
Explain how decision-making
may involve compromise and
cite examples.

9EECEF527F074322A9C5648DD7B1E2AF.description:
Examine the implications of
decisions, consider new
alternatives, and analyze the
need to compromise and its
effect on one’s decisions.

6CA6B0232DF84C628A8381942DF6F551.description:
Assess the role of personal
priorities (e.g. financial,
educational, leisure) in one’s
decision-making.

4C1D6BA320604187AAE56CBA2800D7AA.description:
Monitor the relationships
among education, skills, career
choices, economic conditions
and income.

6AD0E6BC8D5049789325EE3EEEB0F336.description:
Explore and evaluate career
information relevant to making
a decision, and the steps used
to make a decision.

358A93BE7F75434F8D35FEF710F6C446.description: Recognize that decision-making is an important part of an individual’s career development.

2D6D5CDF435E4196B685BDF23067E05B.description:
Evaluate career assessment
results to manage one’s ongoing
academic and career planning.

A036A6EC9BBE466696D49C0FD4BD1CF8.description:
Integrate openness to
nontraditional careers into one’s
career management. (i.e. relative
to one’s gender, race, culture, or
ability.)

1FAB64A8F1044C2B95C164E77976F0E1.description:
Analyze which educational and
career cluster information
resources are useful in one’s
ongoing academic and career
management.

AD355FD691B3483484D63756E613F7E6.description: Understand how accurate, current and unbiased career information is necessary for successful career planning and management using career clusters.

367392F5AAD0426098D06BBD4620B7C8.description:
Use technology to access, store,
manage, analyze and
communicate information to
enhance and improve
achievement.

B5506FF95C734635833751FEB64D60A8.description:
Use study skills, strategies and
learning habits to improve
achievement.

B233C3B18C9149E09689CBCA367889C8.description:
Continue to prioritize
educational achievement areas
needing improvement and adjust
planning.

0673923FC7B54187ADE443B81EB5547F.description:
Understand that ongoing
attainment of knowledge and
skills enhances an individual’s
ability to function effectively in
a diverse and changing economy.

35DE08F17B2C4E7BB889A9CAC8749E2D.description:
Adjust behavior in a way that
integrates the strong connections
between educational
achievement and personal and
career goals.

FC8E63F61EF941F9A78DD18707E015B5.description: Understand the connections among educational achievement, lifelong learning and the career options across career pathways.

9EDA37E9CBF74E39927164471CB74B85.description:
Evaluate how changing societal
needs and economic conditions
affect the nature of work and an
individual’s progression within a
career cluster and pathway.

BD53AB4D19884FDD94A2D491B63A7C47.description:
Re-examine and evaluate how
career clusters and CTE
programs of study can help one
to respond to changing societal
needs and economic conditions.

E2624A58953542C6AA5CE06229D7E757.description: Analyze/compare the industries represented in Maryland’s 10 Career Clusters and how they relate to the needs and functions of the economy and society.

04A0630C23B84722A33D212A1740799C.description:
Career Awareness – Students shall use the Maryland Career Clusters and career pathways including Career and Technology Education (CTE) programs of study in order to
understand their relationship to educational achievement and life-long learning.

7A9FC9B29113497E8A39E4C07B0AFBBA.description:
Monitor financial choices based
on available resources and make
adjustments in goals, plans, and
actions.

781F6880070D4C8FBCBFB326351E7EDF.description:
Monitor, evaluate, and make
necessary adjustments in goals,
plans, and actions.

F567DB910AE44B9DA91EC2BD8FA78852.description: Apply self-knowledge to decision-making and goal-setting.

15AEED2B355448BE82556C0A79DECA11.description:
Assess how changes in
motivations and aspirations over
time personally affects the
process of career development.

02FB81BF9DAB4E34BF513E65B9A75CFE.description:
Evaluate strategies for managing
life changes caused by external
events.

9932CE5585D74CB4A45BA1BBF0D59B16.description:
Appraise strategies for accessing
people and other resources when
assistance is needed.

9917883BBDDA448F8BF1ACA4836CE2CD.description:
Analyze the results of personal
growth and changes throughout
life to determine future growth
opportunities.

DF3BD7D3C30C4F1082995381B8205116.description: Recognize that growth and change are integral parts of the career development process.

7FB17AF7E53742ABAA0C8EB1F60BEBD6.description:
Demonstrate, problem-solve, and
evaluate communication
experiences and use of effective
strategies such as paraphrasing,
reflections, active listening, and
assertive communication.

447FAE3692C24285A4DF865D12E0F159.description:
Demonstrate the ability to
support group decisions, respect
dissenting positions, and/or use
consensus.

78E7EB4C44384BEB819EAFB847B07D45.description:
Evaluate individual and group
performance and plan
improvements using explicit
criteria.

425B5D385D404AA59F1BB45A35813652.description:
Demonstrate and assess the
degree to which one accepts
responsibility for personal
actions including dealing with
outside pressures and
contributing to group activities.

160639B188414A8097D057A24F0B139F.description:
Seek feedback and adjust
behavior in group activities in a
way that is honest, fair, helpful,
and respectful.

70792A14BEF1431F8AED19CC2C966636.description: Demonstrate positive interpersonal skills and respect for diversity to facilitate one’s career development.

AEF1EB64EB0D454A930DA1084B033419.description:
Re-examine and adjust, when
necessary, behaviors and
attitudes to express a positive
self-concept.

39AA853F6403484CBDE35DB15E709A41.description:
Assess the impact of educational
achievement and/or success at
work on self-concept.

41E22B0EBA0A414BB9EFA013EEC35BD8.description:
Expand and/or modify interests
and adjust personal learning and
career goals.

DC3C6823AEB94F0AB0B76CF5F88FF712.description: Acquire and apply self-knowledge to understand one’s abilities, strengths, interests, skills, and talents as seen by self and others.

634D4BD0039B493781ECE96E01E3C8A9.description: Self-Awareness – Students shall acquire and apply self-knowledge in order to develop personal, learning and career goals.
